reviews.review_msg: Very boring material, but a very helpful and nice guy.

treats distance ed students like nothing. didnt show his face once and didnt offer ANY help periods. TA was incharge of everything and was free 2 hrs out of the whole semester. dont take distance with him.
A totally awsome prof. who truly cares whether or not the students understand the material or not. Always avaiable for help. Very good looking and has a great sense of humour!

Out-of-this-world prof. Very VERY helpful when you're stuck. He's very approachable. Doesn't mind repeating what he said. Always asks if there's any questions. I'm actually understanding this class. Take stats with him if you can!! But I think this might be his last class at SFU :( But kudos to whoever gets him as a prof! Uber clarity is defined :)

Great prof. Amazing person. Extremely helpful and approachable. If ever need a question he'll be there to answer it. Shows keen interest in students. Actually wants each and every student to do well. Dude's hilarious too!
Amazing teacher!

absolutely horrible experience sitting through his lectures. He mumbles and slurs his speech making it incredibly hard to understand him. has his back facing the class with a picture of the textbook on the screen (doesnt use a laser so we have no idea what part of the texts he is referring to). repeatedly makes errors while giving examples.

BEST PROF EVER HAD. Go to every lecture because he's so good at explaining concepts and always has time in class for short questions. Has lots of office hours. The assignment questions are vague and r software can be confusing so go to his office hours to clarify. Be comfortable with big concepts know details because there can be trick questions.

Honestly, Marie made stats 201 A LOT easier than I had expected. Yeah, she's kind of all over the place and sucks with technology BUT, her exams are VERY STRAIGHT FORWARD and you can honestly score an A+ in her class if you care enough to study her slides. She is a kind person too!! Give her a chance!

This course was ridiculous, she was so scattered brain and her slides made no sense sometimes and were littered with mistakes. Moreover, the pace in which she went through her slides made me think that she was trying to break the world record for most slides gone through in a minute. The assignments were absolutely ridiculous too, took way too long

She reads right off her notes, which is material that the textbook covers far clearly. I emailed her a couple of times, and she brushes off your emails by referring you to the TAs in the workshop. There is about 5 homework assignments, and none of those questions prepare you for the midterms. Her answer key is super detailed. NOT RECOMMENDED!

You won't understand anything in lecture, but heres the kick! you need to come because she adds in more material than the text! Only class I've read everything assigned. Home work is RIDICULOUS 3.5k words on my 4th/5 with an average at minimum of 2.5k FOR STATS! Very unorganized. AVOID do yourself a favor, caused me to do worse in other classses

Reads off slides word for word, assigns 20-30 questions to be done in a week and only 5 questions are marked. Midterm was too long to complete in amount of given time. Wont reply to emails and doesn't seem to understand what she is talking about half the time.
Reads her slides verbatim, and sometimes confused by her own text. Seemed annoyed when students approached her for help. Will not reply to emails.
Tests were ok but the final was really hard.Class not curved

gives clear lectures. Assignments do take a bit of time to do, but they really help you with the term tests and the final if you do them. Don't really need the textbook, read his online notes/lecture notes and do all his online practice exams and you'll be okay.

It's an online class so you never see or talk to the prof, theres a TM that manages everything. Theres one midterm - super easy if you do the textbook questions - and one 70% final that was way harder than the midterm. Really took everyone by surprise. Heavy on the last 3 chapters covered.

Took this via distance ed. Everything was through the TA, didn't meet him at all. But like any mathstats class if you read the textbook and do practice questions, you will do well. I thought the exams were fair.

He is so confusing. His examples do more damage than good to explain concepts. He constantly tells the class not to copy while he's speaking yet only gives us a very short time to copy after. This is annoying for people like myself who would rather copy and listen simultaneously. Also he yells parts of his lecture which is incredibly irritating.

he's honestly one of the funniest profs i've ever had! SO hilarious! and his voice will randomly get realllyyy loud in the midst of his sentence so you're kept awake the whole time. BUT to be honest, his homework assignments are useless. test is mostly conceptual.  there's like onetwo actual math problems so it's nothing like the assignments.

Scott is overall a good prof.  Although he has an accent, he does his best to clarify the material.  Read the text book it will help you understand the material better--scott sometimes makes things too complicated.  His assignments are long but useful.  His exams are moderately hard but managable.
MOST boring man you will ever encounter!

Amazing prof really made stats 201 enjoyable and uses piazza to answer your questions online and it always gets answered he really helps a lot on assignments. Has great powerpoints easy to follow along and provides great examples.
It was hard to understand her during the lecture; and the textbook was much more useful than the her note. Would not recommend this prof!
The assignments were fair, and the first midterm was easy, however the final was extremely hard and class average dropped; overall a decent but not great professor

She's a very nice lady but she cannot communicate the material. Her midterm and final were both open book. She made the midterm so easy that half the class got 100%... so she HAD to make the final fairly difficult to "balance" things out. Very unfair exams. The assignments were okay but most of the TAs weren't helpful at all so don't expect much.

She is not very clear at all but her exams and assignments are fairly easy. Her notes won't help unless you go to class. Took me an entire semester to learn what the word "arier" means. But extremely nice lady!
